articles.title: Russia Launches Largest Air Attack on Ukraine Capital
articles.summary: Russia conducted its most extensive aerial assault on Ukraine, striking a government building in Kyiv for the first time. The attack killed three people including a mother and baby. Multiple drones targeted the capital city, sparking fires and damaging critical infrastructure in the unprecedented escalation.

articles.title: Japanese Prime Minister Ishiba Announces Resignation to Prevent Party Division
articles.summary: Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has decided to resign following his Liberal Democratic Party coalition's loss of Upper House majority in July elections. The decision aims to prevent internal party divisions as rivals seek leadership changes. His resignation marks another political shift in Japan's unstable governance.
details: Years since last PM served full term: 8

articles.title: Iran Offers Nuclear Monitoring Deal for Sanctions Relief
articles.summary: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi proposed exchanging enhanced nuclear monitoring for lifted sanctions, urging European powers to change course and forge a new agreement. The offer comes as diplomatic tensions rise over Iran's nuclear program and Western concerns about uranium enrichment activities continue.

articles.title: Houthi Drone Strikes Israeli Airport Without Warning Sirens
articles.summary: A Houthi drone hit Ramon Airport's arrivals hall in southern Israel near Eilat without triggering warning sirens. The Israeli military confirmed the strike and launched an investigation into the security failure. This marks a rare successful penetration of Israeli airspace by Yemen-based forces.

articles.title: Mozambique Secures World Bank Support for Massive Hydroelectric Project
articles.summary: Mozambique received World Bank backing for a six billion dollar hydroelectric plant, marking southern Africa's largest energy project in fifty years. The development promises to transform the region's electricity supply and boost economic growth through increased power generation capacity and infrastructure modernization.

articles.title: European Union Hits Google with Massive Antitrust Fine
articles.summary: The European Commission fined Google three point five billion dollars for violating antitrust rules by favoring its advertising services. Google abused dominant positions through its AdX exchange and publisher tools. The company has sixty days to end self-preferencing practices or face additional penalties.
details: Market share: 28% of global digital ads

articles.title: OPEC Plus Announces Major Oil Production Increase
articles.summary: OPEC Plus members will return one point six six million barrels daily to global oil markets through a fresh production hike. The decision reflects changing market dynamics and demand forecasts as the cartel adjusts its output strategy amid evolving energy transition pressures worldwide.

articles.title: Japanese Firm Pioneers Revolutionary Carbon Capture Technology
articles.summary: NGK Insulators, a ceramic components leader transitioning from petrol vehicle parts, developed patented technology to remove carbon dioxide directly from air. The Nagoya-based company aims to revolutionize climate change mitigation through innovative CO2 capture solutions as automotive industry shifts toward electric vehicles.

articles.title: RFK Jr Report Links Tylenol to Autism Causing Stock Plunge
articles.summary: Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr will publish a Department of Health report linking Tylenol use during pregnancy to autism, causing the manufacturer's stock to spiral downward. The controversial report, promoted by Trump and Kennedy in April, raises concerns about acetaminophen safety.

articles.title: Red Sea Cable Cuts Disrupt Internet Across Three Continents
articles.summary: Undersea cables severed in the Red Sea disrupted internet access across Pakistan, Asia, and the Middle East. The damage affected multiple communication lines critical for regional connectivity. Authorities investigate the cause while service providers scramble to reroute traffic through alternative pathways.
